narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry Glick

Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry was very helpful! He was quick to respond to questions on Piazza and had extensive office hours to help students. Definitely one of the best TF's I've had at FES so far.
Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry Glick

Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry is an absolutely excellent TA!! He is extremely skilled in GIS and was seriously there for us any time we had questions. I attended his Office Hours every week and he helped SO much. Thank you!!
Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry Glick
Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Henry Glick  Very patient and made himself available, even beyond his numerous office hours, to help explain concepts, provide feedback, and assist in brainstorming.
Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry was quick to respond to online questions and offered great advice during office hours.
Instructor: Henry Glick  Always available to provide assistance. So great!

Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry is an absolutely excellent TA!! He is extremely skilled in GIS and was seriously there for us any time we had questions. I attended his Office Hours every week and he helped SO much. Thank you!!
Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry was super helpful, especially with the final assignment!
Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry is great! He made himself very available and is knowledgable and clear when helping students
Instructor: Henry Glick  Henry's mastery of GIS concepts is unparalleled. We were fortunate to have him as our TA.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Dana Tomlin is a good lecturer and extremely good at GIS-- he is a wizard! Sometimes when he lectures it is really conceptual and abstract which makes it hard to apply the knowledge to the practical problem sets. He is very responsive and approachable which is really nice.

Prof. Tomlin is easily among my favourite professors at FES. His expertise in the subject of GIS shows in his ability to make complex concepts in GIS intuitive, rather than providing a list of instructions. His course notes, on the other hand, provided a comprehensive and exhaustive guide to all aspects of raster functions and are joy to refer to.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Extensive exposure to ArcGIS tools.

The handouts/tutorials provided on Piazza were very helpful in understanding the material. Dana is extremely knowledgeable about ArcGIS and was able to explain the material in a way that anyone could understand. I liked that he taught us how to think about the problem and make solutions using logic, instead of simply giving everyone the answers.
Weekly assignments were fundamental in building familiarity with the software and conceptual uses of ArcGIS
Learning a new program, learning a marketable skill
Everything! The only aspect that might be annoying is the modules with modelbuilder which will test your patience. Rest is all good!

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Rubrics that clearly explain expectations for assignments as well as grading rationale.

I think there should be a little more clarity on how everyone will be graded. I was a bit unsure what exact criteria Dana was looking for on certain assignments, in terms of presentation of the submission.
Hopefully, this course should be taught utilising ArcGIS Pro.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: NA
All aspects of the lectures and project/lab/discussion section work seamlessly with one another.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Provides exposure to ArcGIS, which is often requested of environmental professionals.
I wanted to gain technical skills and learn GIS.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: See above.
To learn GIS because many of the jobs I'm applying for would like you to have some level of proficiency.
To gain a useful technical skill
Intend on applying spatial analysis into agriculture

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes - Prof. Tomlin is an excellent teacher who clearly cares about his work and is exceptionally knowledgable. He is a very approachable and invested in his students' success.
Yes
Yes, I have learned quite well how to navigate ArcGIS and do a wide range of functions. I also have gotten resources to learn even more material when I have time in the future.
Yes
Deep understanding of raster functionality of ArcGIS. Learnt how to think about statistics from a spatial perspective.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: No group work but it would probably have been useful.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Go to office hours.
If you're interested in GIS, I recommend taking this class!

This course is great to learn raster-based GIS skills. I would recommend it if have some previous experience in GIS because there is a steep learning curve. The problem sets really do take a lot of time each week which can be frustrating, but there is a feeling of accomplishment when you finish them.
Take it! Simple!
